marketNews.title: Car Wholesales -11% YoY in January 2025, Motorcycles -6% YoY
marketNews.content: Gaikindo noted that national car wholesales in January 2025 reached 61,843 units (-11.3% YoY, -22.5% MoM), equivalent to 6.8-8.24% of Gaikindo's 2025 target in the range of 750,000-900,000 units. Astra International ($ASII) recorded Toyota wholesales of 22,082 units (+5.2% YoY, -17% MoM) in January 2025, while Daihatsu wholesales reached 9,983 units (-31% YoY, -24% MoM). Combined, ASII's two main brands recorded a sales performance decline of -9.3% YoY and -19% MoM in January 2025, which was better than the industry realization (-11% YoY, -23% MoM), resulting in their combined market share increasing to 51.8% in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 49.8%, January 2024: 50.7%). ASII's main competitor, Honda, recorded the relatively best performance in January 2025 with wholesales reaching 7,276 units in January 2025 (-14% YoY, -13% MoM), causing its market share to rise to 11.8% (vs. December 2024: 10.5%). On the other hand, Mitsubishi was ASII's main competitor with the worst performance in January 2025, with sales falling (-44% YoY, -47% MoM) to 5,028 units. Meanwhile, BYD recorded wholesales of 1,114 units in January 2025 (-29% MoM) and 16,543 units since first commencing deliveries in June 2024. Despite the monthly decline, BYD's average monthly wholesales since June 2024 (~2,067 units) is still above Hyundai (~1,816 units). Hyundai itself recorded wholesales of 2,308 units in January 2025 (-23% YoY, +26% MoM). The Chairman of Gaikindo, Jongkie Sugiarto, said that his party maintained the projection of car sales throughout 2025 reaching at least 900,000 units, an increase of approximately +4% YoY from the 2024 wholesales realization. Meanwhile, the Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales reached 557,191 units in January 2025 (-6% YoY, +38% MoM), marking a third consecutive month of annual sales decline. This realization is equivalent to 8.3-8.7% of AISI's 2025 target in the range of 6.4-6.7 million units.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The decline in both car and motorcycle sales may indicate weak public purchasing power at the start of 2025. Going forward, investors need to monitor the wholesales developments in February and March 2025, considering that historically car and motorcycle sales before the Eid period - which will take place around March 31-April 1, 2025 - are usually quite strong. In addition, although the 2025 sales target has not significantly increased, we assess that additional catalysts are needed for the car sales target to be achieved. Responding to this wholesales data, automotive stocks such as ASII (-1.72%), IMAS (-1.25%), AUTO (-3.22%), DRMA (-0.54%), and MPMX (-1.04%) experienced price decreases in today's trading, Monday (10/2).

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Commissioner Buys 800,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea Commissioner, Erwin Ciputra, purchased 800,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 3,143.75 rupiah per share on February 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached 2.5 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Erwin Ciputra's ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0779% to 0.0858%.

tickerNews.title: Indosat recorded net profit of IDR 1.03 trillion in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: ISAT: Indosat recorded a net profit of 1.03 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-40% YoY, -10% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 4.9 trillion rupiah (+9% YoY), below expectations as it was equivalent to 94% of the consensus estimate. At the operational level, operating profit in 4Q24 reached 2.4 trillion rupiah (-13% YoY, -11% QoQ), so the operating profit throughout 2024 reached 10.8 trillion rupiah (+16% YoY) and was below expectations as it was equivalent to 96% of the consensus estimate. The average revenue per user (ARPU) for the mobile segment in 4Q24 rose to 38.9 thousand rupiah (+1% YoY, +5% QoQ), but the number of subscribers decreased to 94.7 million (-4% YoY, -4% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: Merdeka Copper Gold plans to issue bonds worth IDR 2.8 trillion
tickerNews.content: MDKA: Merdeka Copper Gold plans to issue bonds worth 2.8 trillion rupiah, with the proceeds intended for the repayment of previous bonds. The bonds to be issued consist of Series A worth 856 billion rupiah (7.25% annual interest and 367-day maturity) and Series B worth 1.94 trillion rupiah (8.75% annual interest and 3-year maturity). The bonds have obtained an idA+ rating from Pefindo. The public offering period runs from February 19-20, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bank Tabungan Negara officially launched super app named Bale by BTN
tickerNews.content: BBTN: Bank Tabungan Negara officially launched a super app named Bale by BTN on Sunday (9/2). The President Director of BBTN, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, said that the Bale by BTN application is intended to increase transactions through digitalization. Nixon mentioned that since its initial introduction until release, Bale by BTN has had 2.3 million users, targeting around 3.6-4 million users by the end of 2025 and more than 5 million in 2026. BBTN itself budgeted capex of 1 trillion rupiah in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 900 billion rupiah) for digital transformation this year.

tickerNews.title: Medco Energi Internasional starts commercial operations for the Ijen geothermal power plant
tickerNews.content: MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional through its business entity, PT Medco Cahaya Geothermal, announced that it has commenced commercial operation of the Ijen geothermal power plant (PLTP) in East Java. The PLTP is planned to have a total capacity of 110 MW, with an initial phase capacity of 35 MW. The Ijen PLTP already has a 30-year electricity purchase agreement and is expected to supply electricity to around 85,000 households in the Java-Bali system.

tickerNews.title: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna recorded sales volume of 20.3 billion sticks in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: HMSP: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna recorded a sales volume of 20.3 billion sticks in 4Q24 (-1.1% YoY, -1.9% QoQ). This result caused HMSP's sales volume for 2024 to drop to 80.8 billion sticks (-3.7% YoY). On the other hand, the industry-wide sales volume in Indonesia reached 74.1 billion sticks in 4Q24 (+1.9% YoY, -1.9% QoQ) and 295.5 billion sticks throughout 2024 (+1.1% YoY). As a result, HMSP's market share in 2024 fell to 27.4% (vs. 2023: 28.7%). Nevertheless, HMSP's quarterly market share started to stabilize around 27.3-27.4% in 2Q24-4Q24. Based on product segmentation, HMSP's cigarette sales during 2024 decreased by -4.5% YoY to 79.6 billion sticks, while IQOS sales grew approximately 2 times to 1.2 billion sticks.

tickerNews.title: Timah targets net profit of IDR 1-1.5 trillion in 2025
tickerNews.content: TINS: Timah Corporate Secretary, Rendi Kurniawan, said that the company targets a net profit of around 1-1.5 trillion rupiah during 2025, with revenue projections reaching 12-13 trillion rupiah. Rendi mentioned that the 2025 target is driven by increased tin resources and reserves as well as the opening of new mines. Rendi explained that there will be an increase in tin ore production capacity and tin metal sales of about +10-20% YoY in 2025. TINS management confirmed that they will distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year with an estimated dividend payout ratio of around 30-35%.

tickerNews.title: Harum Energy allocates capex of US$400 million for 2025
tickerNews.content: HRUM: Harum Energy Corporate Secretary, Renny Soependi, said that the company allocated capex of around 400 million US dollars in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 687 million US dollars), with most of it being used for the development of nickel ore mining operations and the completion of the HPAL smelter project. Kontan reported that the HPAL smelter project is expected to start contributing to HRUM's performance as early as the end of 2025 or early 2026.

tickerNews.title: Brigit Biofarmaka Teknologi sets a target of tripling sales with a new factory
tickerNews.content: OBAT: President Director of Brigit Biofarmaka Teknologi, Is Heriyanto, said that the company will inaugurate a new factory in Sukoharjo, Central Java, in mid-February 2025. The production facility is targeted to contribute an annual turnover of up to 250 billion rupiah, thus being able to boost the company's revenue by 3 times. The factory will later produce herbal supplement products in strip capsule, blister, bottle forms, and liquid medicine in both sachet and bottle packaging.

tickerNews.title: Dian Swastatika Sentosa obtains a credit facility up to IDR 1 trillion from Bank Negara Indonesia
tickerNews.content: DSSA: Dian Swastatika Sentosa obtained a credit facility of up to 1 trillion rupiah from Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI). These funds are intended to finance general needs, including operations and the development of subsidiaries.

tickerNews.title: US President Donald Trump announces 25% tariffs on all steel and aluminum imports
tickerNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, said on Sunday (9/2) that he will announce tariffs of 25% on all steel and aluminum imports to the US. Furthermore, Trump also said he will announce retaliatory tariffs on Tuesday (11/2) or Wednesday (12/2) for all countries that impose tariffs on the US.

tickerNews.title: Ministry of Manpower records over 70,000 layoffs in 2024, layoff threat continues in 2025
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Manpower noted that there were 77,965 workers who experienced layoffs (PHK) during 2024, an increase of +20.2% YoY from the 2023 realization of 64,855 workers. DKI Jakarta (17,085 people) became the province with the highest number of employee layoffs in 2024, followed by Central Java (13,130 people) and Banten (13,042 people).

tickerNews.title: ESDM studies new coal DMO mechanism for power plants
tickerNews.content: A Director at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Tri Winarno, said on Friday (7/2) that his party will study a new mechanism regarding the domestic market obligation (DMO) for coal for PLN power plants. Tri's statement responded to the desire of coal entrepreneurs to increase the DMO price for coal, which since 2018 has only been set at 70 US dollars per ton for PLN power plants and 90 US dollars per ton for the industrial sector. Tri mentioned that future changes in the DMO price will affect the amount of subsidies and so on, thus the most likely adjustment is the coal DMO mechanism for electricity.

tickerNews.title: 50% electricity tariff discount policy for customers under 2,200 VA is under evaluation, awaiting government decision
tickerNews.content: A Director at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Jisman Hutajulu, said on Sunday (9/2) that the government is currently evaluating the policy of a 50% electricity tariff discount for customers with a capacity of 2,200 VA and below. Previously, the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated last week that the government would not extend the electricity tariff discount, which is set to end in February 2025.

tickerNews.title: US Bureau of Labor Statistics records non-farm payroll of 143 thousand jobs in January 2025
tickerNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics recorded non-farm payrolls of 143 thousand jobs in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 307 thousand), lower than the estimate of 170 thousand. Meanwhile, the unemployment rate in the US fell by -0.1 percentage point to 4% in January 2025, marking the lowest level since May 2024 and better than the consensus expectation of 4.1%.

tickerNews.title: China's national blue chip statistics recorded CPI inflation at 0.5% YoY in January 2025
tickerNews.content: China's national bureau recorded that Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in China reached 0.5% YoY in January 2025 (vs. Dec 2024: 0.1% YoY inflation), exceeding the consensus expectation of 0.4% YoY. This result marks the highest annual CPI inflation level since August 2024, driven by seasonal effects from the Lunar New Year as well as stimulus measures from the government and accommodative monetary policy from the central bank. On a monthly basis, CPI inflation in China reached 0.7% MoM (vs. Dec 2024: 0% MoM), lower than the consensus expectation of 0.8% MoM although marking the highest level in the last 11 months. Core inflation stood at 0.6% YoY in January 2025 (vs. Dec 2024: 0.2% YoY inflation), marking the highest level in the last 7 months.

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia records realization of foreign exchange reserves in January 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of January 2025 increased to 156.1 billion US dollars (vs. December 2024: 155.7 billion US dollars). This increase in foreign exchange reserves stemmed from the government's global bond issuance as well as tax and service receipts, amidst the policy of stabilizing the rupiah exchange rate in line with the ongoing uncertainty in global financial markets. The foreign exchange reserve position at the end of January 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.7 months of imports or 6.5 months of imports and government foreign debt payments, which is above the international adequacy standard of approximately 3 months of imports.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources' Investor Relation Director and Corporate Secretary passed away
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources ($BUMI) announced that the Director of Investor Relations and Corporate Secretary, Dileep Srivastava, passed away on Saturday (8/2).

tickerNews.title: Telkom Indonesia states that the designation of Isa Rachmatarwata as a suspect in the Jiwasraya corruption case is not related to his position as a company commissioner
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia ($TLKM) stated that the designation of the commissioner of the company, Isa Rachmatarwata, as a suspect in the corruption case regarding the management of PT Asuransi Jiwasraya's finances and funds for the 2008-2018 period is not related to his position as a company commissioner. TLKM explained that this case is related to Isa's position as Head of the Insurance Bureau at the Capital Market and Financial Institutions Supervisory Agency during the 2006-2012 period.

tickerNews.title: Jaya Trishindo Controller purchased approximately 55.3 million HELI shares
tickerNews.content: The Controller and President Commissioner of Jaya Trishindo ($HELI), PT Startel Communication, bought approximately 55.3 million HELI shares at an average price of 287 rupiah per share on January 31, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 15.9 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Startel Communication's ownership in HELI increased from 23.05% to 29.69%.

tickerNews.title: Duta Anggada Realty Controller and President Commissioner sold 27 million DART shares
tickerNews.content: The Controller and President Commissioner of Duta Anggada Realty ($DART), Hartadi Angkosubroto, sold 27 million DART shares at an average price of 217 rupiah per share on February 5, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 5.8 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Hartadi Angkosubroto's ownership in DART decreased from 47.51% to 46.65%.
